title: Screen not waking for silenced notifications
content:
Notifications from apps that have been "Silence"d do not wake the phone's screen.  Is this the intended functionality?  I don't want any app at all but the phone and alarm to make any sound or pop-up, but I do want the notification to appear as usual on the notification bar and drop-down shade, and I also want it to momentarily wake the screen in Ambient Mode.  Does the "Silence" toggle turn off wake-up in addition to sound?

For example, I want to be notified each time an email comes in through the Gmail app.  But I absolutely want no sound, LED flash, or on-screen popup.  However, if the screen is off, I still want the notification in question to quickly fade on and then fade off.  Will that only work for non "Silence"d apps?  Is my only option to un-Silence Gmail, set it to notify, but select a notification sound of "None" or "No Sound"?
